p: The phytochemical screening results revealed the presence of anthraquinone, saponins, alkaloids, flavonoids, lignans, xanthones, cardiac glycosides, terpenes, steroids, coumarins, phenols, tannins and terpenoids as constituent phytochemicals of methanol leaf extract of Vernonia amygdalina. However, as depicted in Table 1, the total flavonoid content of the extract is 108.25 mg/g Catechin equivalent, the total phenol content is 189.52 mg/g Gallic acid equivalent, the tannin content is 146.33 mg/g Gallic acid equivalent while the alkaloids, saponins and total terpenoids are 11.77, 7.52 and 10.71 % yield per gram respectively.
